title: Frito Chicken Casserole Recipe
description: This chicken casserole topped with chili cheese Fritos® is cheesy, crunchy, colorful, loaded with flavor, and the ultimate comfort food.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Casserole Recipes Chicken Frito Chicken Casserole 4.6 (7) 7 Reviews 2 Photos This chicken casserole topped with chili cheese Fritos is cheesy, crunchy, colorful, loaded with flavor, and the ultimate comfort food. Better yet, the prep only dirties up one pot. Serve with salsa, sour cream, and chopped cilantro if you like. Submitted by Soup Loving Nicole Updated on July 5, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 2 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Stand Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 casserole Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 tablespoon unsalted butter 1 small onion, chopped 4 cups cubed cooked chicken breast 1 (15.25 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained 1 (15.2 ounce) can corn, drained 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®), undrained 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese ⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese 1 (10 ounce) bag chili and cheese flavored corn chips (such as Fritos® Chili Cheese® Corn Chips) Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chicken, beans, corn, cream of chicken soup, tomatoes and chiles (with juice), green chiles, cream cheese, and cilantro. Cook until cream cheese has melted, about 5 minutes. Spread out 1/3 of the chips on the bottom of a 9x13 inch rectangular casserole dish. Top with 1/2 of the chicken mixture. Top chicken mixture with 1/3 of shredded Cheddar cheese. Repeat the layer. Top the 2nd layer with remaining 1/3 of the chips and remaining 1/3 of Cheddar cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese has melted and is lightly browned, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, cover, and let sit for 30 minutes so it can set before cutting into squares. SoupLovingNicole I Made It Print Add Your Photo Photos of Frito Chicken Casserole 01 of 02 Photo by  Staci 02 of 02 Photo by  Staci 06/26/2023 Delicious! If you love Chili Cheese Fritos, this is definitely for you! However I am sure it would be great with Doritos or regular corn chips if that's what you had on hand.I followed the recipe exactly as written other than using thawed frozen corn because I had forgotten to buy canned. I divided the filling between two smaller casseroles so that I could freeze one for later and I am so glad I did, because we will definitely want to have this meal again. Adults and kids all gave it two big thumbs up! 1 You’ll Also Love Pantry Chicken Casserole 67 Ratings Chicken Broccoli Alfredo Bake 1 Rating Pinto Bean and Chicken Casserole 12 Ratings Tuscan Chicken Casserole 7 Ratings Loaded Cauliflower Chicken Casserole 27 Ratings Everything Bagel Seasoned Chicken Casserole 6 Ratings Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole 55 Ratings Easy Monterey Chicken Casserole Chicken and Broccoli Casserole 3 Ratings Cheesy Chicken, Broccoli, and Rice Casserole 8 Ratings Chicken and Summer Squash Casserole 14 Ratings Chicken, Broccoli, and Cottage Cheese Casserole 13 Ratings Chicken Broccoli Rice Skillet 6 Ratings Cheddar Cheese Chicken Pasta Bake 18 Ratings Doritos Chicken Casserole 126 Ratings Silver's Savory Chicken and Broccoli Casserole 230 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Soup Loving Nicole
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.;Add chicken, beans, corn, cream of chicken soup, tomatoes and chiles (with juice), green chiles, cream cheese, and cilantro. Cook until cream cheese has melted, about 5 minutes.;Spread out 1/3 of the chips on the bottom of a 9x13 inch rectangular casserole dish. Top with 1/2 of the chicken mixture. Top chicken mixture with 1/3 of shredded Cheddar cheese. Repeat the layer. Top the 2nd layer with remaining 1/3 of the chips and remaining 1/3 of Cheddar cheese.;Bake in the preheated oven until cheese has melted and is lightly browned, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, cover, and let sit for 30 minutes so it can set before cutting into squares. SoupLovingNicole
